member.name: IXAudio2Voice.DestroyVoice
member.summary: Destroys the voice. If necessary, stops the voice and removes it from the XAudio2 graph.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.DisableEffect
member.summary: Disables the effect at a given position in the effect chain of the voice.
member.param: Zero-based index of an effect in the effect chain of the voice.
TBD
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, an error code. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of valid error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.EnableEffect
member.summary: Enables the effect at a given position in the effect chain of the voice.
member.param: Zero-based index of an effect in the effect chain of the voice.
TBD
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, an error code. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.GetChannelVolumes
member.summary: Returns the volume levels for the voice, per channel.
member.param: Confirms the channel count of the voice.
Returns the current volume level of each channel in the voice. The array must have at least Channels elements. See Remarks for more information on volume levels.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.GetEffectParameters
member.summary: Returns the current effect-specific parameters of a given effect in the voice's effect chain.
member.param: Zero-based index of an effect within the voice's effect chain.
Returns the current values of the effect-specific parameters.
Size, in bytes, of the pParameters array.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of error codes.
Fails with E_NOTIMPL if the effect does not support a generic parameter control interface.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.GetEffectState
member.summary: Returns the running state of the effect at a specified position in the effect chain of the voice.
member.param: Zero-based index of an effect in the effect chain of the voice.
Returns TRUE If the effect is enabled. If the effect is disabled, returns FALSE.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.GetFilterParameters
member.param: Pointer to an structure containing the filter information.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.GetOutputFilterParameters
member.summary: Returns the filter parameters from one of this voice's sends.
member.param: pointer to the destination voice of the send whose filter parameters will be read.
Pointer to an structure containing the filter information.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.GetOutputMatrix
member.summary: Gets the volume level of each channel of the final output for the voice. These channels are mapped to the input channels of a specified destination voice.

param.name: pDestinationVoice
param.para: Pointer specifying the destination to retrieve the output matrix for.
param.div: Note If the voice sends to a single target voice then specifying NULL will cause GetOutputMatrix to operate on that target voice.

member.param: Confirms the output channel count of the voice. This is the number of channels that are produced by the last effect in the chain.
Confirms the input channel count of the destination voice.

Array of [SourceChannels * DestinationChannels] volume levels sent to the destination voice. The level sent from source channel S to destination channel D is returned in the form pLevelMatrix[DestinationChannels × S + D]. See Remarks for more information on volume levels.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.GetVoiceDetails
member.summary: Returns information about the creation flags, input channels, and sample rate of a voice.
member.param: structure containing information about the voice.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.GetVolume
member.summary: Gets the current overall volume level of the voice.
member.param: Returns the current overall volume level of the voice. See Remarks for more information on volume levels.
member.returns: This method does not return a value.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.SetChannelVolumes
member.summary: Sets the volume levels for the voice, per channel.
member.param: Number of channels in the voice.
Array containing the new volumes of each channel in the voice. The array must have Channels elements. See Remarks for more information on volume levels.
TBD
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.SetEffectChain
member.summary: Replaces the effect chain of the voice.

param.name: pEffectChain
param.para: Pointer to an structure that describes the new effect chain to use. If NULL is passed, the current effect chain is removed.
param.div: Note If pEffectChain is non-NULL, the structure that it points to must specify at least one effect.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, an error code.
See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.SetEffectParameters
member.summary: Sets parameters for a given effect in the voice's effect chain.
member.param: Zero-based index of an effect within the voice's effect chain.
Returns the current values of the effect-specific parameters.
Size of the pParameters array in bytes.
TBD
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, an error code. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of error codes.
Fails with E_NOTIMPL if the effect does not support a generic parameter control interface.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.SetFilterParameters
member.param: Pointer to an structure containing the filter information.
TBD
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.SetOutputFilterParameters
member.summary: Sets the filter parameters on one of this voice's sends.
member.param: pointer to the destination voice of the send whose filter parameters will be set.
Pointer to an structure containing the filter information.
TBD
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.SetOutputMatrix
member.summary: Sets the volume level of each channel of the final output for the voice. These channels are mapped to the input channels of a specified destination voice.

param.name: pDestinationVoice
param.para: Pointer to a destination for which to set volume levels.
param.div: Note If the voice sends to a single target voice then specifying NULL will cause SetOutputMatrix to operate on that target voice.

member.param: Confirms the output channel count of the voice. This is the number of channels that are produced by the last effect in the chain.
Confirms the input channel count of the destination voice.

Array of [SourceChannels × DestinationChannels] volume levels sent to the destination voice. The level sent from source channel S to destination channel D is specified in the form pLevelMatrix[SourceChannels × D + S].
For example, when rendering two-channel stereo input into 5.1 output that is weighted toward the front channels—but is absent from the center and low-frequency channels—the matrix might have the values shown in the following table.
Output Left Input [Array Index] Right Input [Array Index]
Left 1.0 [0] 0.0 [1]
Right 0.0 [2] 1.0 [3]
Front Center 0.0 [4] 0.0 [5]
LFE 0.0 [6] 0.0 [7]
Rear Left 0.8 [8] 0.0 [9]
Rear Right 0.0 [10] 0.8 [11]
Note The left and right input are fully mapped to the output left and right channels; 80 percent of the left and right input is mapped to the rear left and right channels.See Remarks for more information on volume levels.
TBD
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.SetOutputVoices
member.summary: Designates a new set of submix or mastering voices to receive the output of the voice.
member.param: Array of structure pointers to destination voices. If pSendList is NULL, the voice will send its output to the current mastering voice. To set the voice to not send its output anywhere set the OutputCount member of XAUDIO2_VOICE_SENDS to 0. All of the voices in a send list must have the same input sample rate, see XAudio2 Sample Rate Conversions for additional information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2Voice.SetVolume
member.summary: Sets the overall volume level for the voice.
member.param: Overall volume level to use. See Remarks for more information on volume levels.
TBD
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of error codes.
